intro: Begonia mamutensis, commonly known as the Mamutén Begonia, is a rare and unique species native to the high-altitude regions of Ecuador. It is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that often display intricate patterns and vibrant colors. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, thriving in the understory of cloud forests. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive shape and coloration that varies by subspecies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Begonia mamutensis is considered a species of conservation concern.
